etymology.description: 衣(衣) (yī, "clothing") + 皮(皮) (pí, "skin") = phono-semantic combination -> passive marker
etymology.interpretation: The character 被(bèi) originally relates to clothing and has been extended to a broader grammatical use. The semantic component 衣(衣) (yī, "clothing") indicates relation to something that covers or is worn, while 皮(皮) (pí, "skin") provides the phonetic clue.

examples.chinese: 水被我喝了(水被我喝了)。
examples.english: The water was drunk by me.

examples.chinese: 书被老师借走了(書被老師借走了)。
examples.pinyin: Shū bèi lǎoshī jiè zǒu le
examples.english: The book was borrowed by the teacher.

examples.chinese: 礼物被他精心包装了(禮物被他精心包裝了)，惊喜溢于言表(驚喜溢於言表)。
examples.pinyin: Lǐwù bèi tā jīngxīn bāozhuāng le, jīngxǐ yì yú yánbiǎo
examples.english: The gift was carefully wrapped by him, and the surprise was evident.
